projectstructures

Class Domain<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastructs.graphs.Graph<K>
      • projectstructures.Domain<K>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataStructure<K>

    public class Domain<K>
extends Graph<K>
    Author:
    zyoruk A domain is a computer which contains several regions. It extends from the graph data structure. This will send several messages to bounty hunters and create them, as well.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Domain()
      The constructor will initialize the variables and set the Domain's IP using the current machine IP.

    • Method Summary

      void askForBountyPoints()
      This will make every bounty hunter to send their carried points to the home domain.

      Creates a new BountyHunter, cannot do it directly into a foreign domain.

      Each Domain will be able to send a "Halt" message which means that the domain wants to end the game.

      The programm will need somehow to know the Bounty Hunter list for some methods.

    • Method Detail

      • askForBountyPoints

        public void askForBountyPoints()
        This will make every bounty hunter to send their carried points to the home domain.

      • createbountyHunter

        public void createbountyHunter(Region pWhereToBeCreated)
        Creates a new BountyHunter, cannot do it directly into a foreign domain.
        Parameters:
        pWhereToBeCreated - is the region to create the bounty hunter.

      • endBountyRecollection

        public void endBountyRecollection(boolean pHaltMessage)
        Each Domain will be able to send a "Halt" message which means that the domain wants to end the game. Then, every single bounty hunter must return to their respective home domain. This method receives the message and do the respective operations.
        Parameters:
        pHaltMessage - it is a boolean.

      • getBountyHunterList

        public SimpleList<BountyHunter> getBountyHunterList()
        The programm will need somehow to know the Bounty Hunter list for some methods. So, we don't want to make the local fields public , we just implement a getter when needed.
        Returns:
        List of bounty hunters

      • getIP

        public java.lang.String getIP()
        This gets the current Domain's IP.
        Returns:
        Domain's IP

      • halt

        public boolean halt()
        Sets flag to True, this means that the game ends.
        Returns:
        Domain's halt flag as true.

      • addRegionToVisit

        public void addRegionToVisit(int pBountyHunterID,
                    java.lang.String pRegionToVisitID)
        The Domain will give a bounty hunter a new region to visit.
        Parameters:
        pBountyHunterID - this is the ID of a bounty hunter
        pRegionToVisitID - this the ID of the region to visit.

      • recallBountyHunter

        public void recallBountyHunter()
        Tells every bounty hunter to return home.
